title: Just use Postgres
dot:
digraph DatabaseAdvice{node[shape=box, style="rounded, filled", fillcolor=lightgrey, fontname="Arial"];edge[fontname="Arial", fontsize=10];Advice[label="Advice: Use Postgres for Persistent Storage"];Sqlite[label="Why not Sqlite?"];DynamoDB[label="Why not DynamoDB/Cassandra/MongoDB?"];Valkey[label="Why not Valkey?"];Datomic[label="Why not Datomic?"];XTDB[label="Why not XTDB?"];Kafka[label="Why not Kafka?"];ElasticSearch[label="Why not ElasticSearch?"];MSSQL_Oracle[label="Why not MSSQL/Oracle DB?"];MySQL[label="Why not MySQL?"];AIVectorDB[label="Why not AI Vector DB?"];GoogleSheets[label="Why not Google Sheets?"];Advice->Sqlite;Advice->DynamoDB;Advice->Valkey;Advice->Datomic;Advice->XTDB;Advice->Kafka;Advice->ElasticSearch;Advice->MSSQL_Oracle;Advice->MySQL;Advice->AIVectorDB;Advice->GoogleSheets;Sqlite->"Single file storage
Limits scalability";DynamoDB->"Requires upfront data & access pattern knowledge
Scalability with consistency trade-offs";Valkey->"RAM limitations
Data modeling concessions";Datomic->"JVM language dependency
Poor tooling outside SQL";XTDB->"New and experimental
Uncertain long-term support";Kafka->"Complex log management
Extra infrastructure overhead";ElasticSearch->"Best for search-focused apps
Needs ETL for data";MSSQL_Oracle->"High cost & lock-in concerns";MySQL->"Lacks certain features
Potential lock-in";AIVectorDB->"New and risky
AI bubble concerns";GoogleSheets->"Limited but feasible for simple needs";PostgresBenefits[label="Postgres Benefits:
- Network accessible
- Automatic backups
- Proven reliability"];Advice->PostgresBenefits[style=dashed, color=blue];}
